title: Jesse Ventura - Ballotpedia
snippet: Jesse Ventura was the Governor of Minnesota. Ventura assumed office on January 8, 1999. Ventura left office on January 6, 2003. title: Jesse Ventura | The Institute of Politics at Harvard University
snippet: JESSE VENTURA was elected the 38th Governor of Minnesota on November 3, 1998 defeating Attorney General Hubert H. (Skip) Humphrey III and St. Paul Mayor Norm Coleman. He served as Governor for one term. Shocking the political establishment, Ventura became the only Reform Party candidate to ...

title: Jesse Ventura | Biography & Facts | Britannica
snippet: His first foray into politics was as mayor of Brooklyn Park (1991â€“95). In the late 1990s he worked as a radio shock jock. ... In 1998 Ventura ran for governor of Minnesota as the Reform Party candidate.

title: Jesse Ventura | Research Starters | EBSCO Research
snippet: Ventura's political career began in 1990, when he ran for mayor of Brooklyn Park, a suburb of Minneapolis. He ran as an independent, hoping to break what he saw as the "good old boy" methods of the incumbent mayor and city council.
